thread.title: Seattle Sounders left back Dylan Remick could return to the starting lineup against the Houston Dynamo
thread.title_full: Seattle Sounders left back Dylan Remick could return to the starting lineup against the Houston Dynamo | The Seattle Times

author: Matt Pentz
title: Seattle Sounders left back Dylan Remick could return to the starting lineup against the Houston Dynamo
text:
Third-year defender Dylan Remick has not played for the Sounders in MLS action since Aug. 9, when Seattle lost 3-1 to the Galaxy in L.A. But with fellow left backs Oniel Fisher and Leo Gonzalez both recovering from injury, the 24-year-old is likely to get the start by default on Sunday in Houston.
Remick appeared to have locked up a starting spot earlier this season, slipping down behind the rookie Fisher on depth chart as the summer progressed and confidence ebbed.
“Dylan has kept his head up and trained well and has continued to work hard,” Sounders coach Sigi Schmid said Friday. “You never know when your opportunity is going to come. Just like with Chad Barrett the other night, you have to be ready to take advantage. You don’t ask why the opportunity comes about, you just take advantage of it.”
When forward Nelson Valdez was injured during warmups prior to the recent Galaxy game, Barrett was summoned from the pregame buffet as a last-minute replacement. He proceeded to score the game-tying goal in stoppage time as the Sounders rallied for a point.
